review_title: A good but not perfect product
review_comment: This product really gives a good first impression.  - No trouble at all connecting like other Bluetooth devices where you kinda have to brace yourself to deal with trouble connecting  - The battery life is great too: you can go for around 2 days without charging.  - But the sound quality wasn’t like ~great. It’s just like the regular EarPods. No bass, no pop, just mediocre sound qualityBut the more you use it, you’ll find more trouble: especially with the auto-connect feature  - I like to watch youtube on my iPad while I’m watching lectures or on a Zoom call.  - And these Air Pods really struggle with, which devices am I gonna connect to.  - It’s kinda annoying to have to manually switch between devices (and it lagged too)  - I think this is kinda short-sighted of Apple since it’s pretty clear that their users are likely to have an ecosystem of Apple products already and like to use them simultaneously.2nd problem: you don’t know if it’s connected or not  - This has happened a couple of times: when I have my laptop and iPad, both devices will show that the AirPods are connected.  - But it’s a guessing game of which audio it’s gonna play.  - So many times when my laptop just plays the audio out loud and I have no idea.  - There’s no way for me to check if the audio if from my mac or is it from my earbuds.Overall: It's pretty affordable Apple wireless earbuds in comparison to other models. So if you're on a budget and dying to have decent wireless earbuds, go for it. I would not recommend it if you're looking for really good sound quality and noise-canceling earbuds.

good

AirPods have always been a complete disaster. I’ve had three pairs of these over the years and they are all share the same trait: ABSOLUTE CRAP. I rarely use them anymore and I will never buy them again or recommend them. They are a complete rip off for the price you are paying. Apple only made the thing for pure profit and nothing else. Do not be fooled by the ads on tv for airpods, they are full of a bunch of bs and make them seem ages better than what they actually are. The build quality is ok. The sound quality however is terrible. The mids are ok but there is one thing that pisses me off, airpods HAVE NO TOP END. None. 0. They sound terrible. They sound like regular old earbuds in the sound quality department. Definitely not $130 “headphones.” If you could even call them headphones. The third problem is the way they fit in your ears. They fit like crap. They never feel like they are truly in the right spot and they constantly move around and shift position. And the sound gets worse every time they move. So you have to fiddle around with them to get them in the right spot to delver the best possible sound. The fourth problem is the way they preform around noise. Even since the first time I got airpods, I only liked using them in a near silent room. If you try to use them where there is a bunch of noise or if you are outside and it’s noisy, you have to jack the volume way up. Making the sound even worse. The more noise you have, the more of the top end disappears. For example, if you are outside and you are on your morning run (which is what I was looking forward to using these for when I first got them) you might as well forget it because all you will hear is the upper mids and treble. And trying to adjust any audio settings to fix that problem makes them sound even worse. The fifth problem is the battery life. The battery life is mediocre. And that is a generous statement. Under normal use (for me anyway), The case needs charging about once a week which isn’t bad. But that actual AirPods are not good. I normally have to charge these about twice a day sometimes even three times. The batteries in them are not meant to last. The more you use these, the less they hold their charge. It’s ridiculous. When I first got them, I could go a whole day without having to charge them and now I Cant go a full day without having to charge them at least twice. It seems to me that Apple designed the battery in these to absolutely kill itself right before they release a new version of airpods. So that way everyone will happily fork over hundreds of dollars to get the next pair of overpriced ShitPods. Yes, you may look cool wearing them. But here is a fact, no one hates airpods more that people who own airpods. If I pay $130, I better be getting some very decent headphones. But no. These are crap. Back in 2012, I bought an iPhone 4s and it came with a pair of standard Apple earbuds. I still own those earbuds. What makes me frustrated is that those earbuds from 2012 sound ages better than the CrapPods. I’d AT LEAST expect the sound quality  to be the same if not better than some $15 earbuds from 2012. The bottom line is: do not buy these if you are looking for some actually decent headphones. It will save you a lot of time and money. There are so many better alternatives out there for the money. Don’t get ripped off. Don’t waste your money. Don’t buy airpods. Get something else.

It took me two years to get a ps5, which I finally obtained directly from Sony through an invitation only program.  Less than a week later, it was already refusing to turn on and/or connect to my Sony Bravia tv.  The troubleshooting process is worse than useless, as the console only communicates through lights on the chassis, and my typical pattern — blue, flashing white, solid white, orange, nothing — doesn’t even appear in the user manual.  Rebuilding the database, safe mode, none of them did a thing.  This is a $500 machine that is less reliable and much uglier than my $20 alarm clock.  The chassis even feels cheap, like a poorly designed blender.  I own every PlayStation all the way back to the PS1, and all of them still work great to this day — except the one I got last week.  Sony support is also useless, and tried to connect me to another PlayStation user to talk about my problem — a non employee!  The entire thing feels like a scam, and I have lost a huge amount of respect and goodwill for this company.  They have no idea what they are doing, and no plans to figure it out.

Got our first console through the Sony invite, no problems whatsoever.  Then I got another invite from Amazon and we pounced on it so the wife could upgrade her PS4.  Right out of the box the new one would stop pairing with the controller within a minute of startup! We never even got to finish the updates, as we can't use the controller after the first couple commands work fine.  Spent way too much time on the phone with Amazon, who in the end could only offer a refund.  No replacement!  Upon going to the Sony page, they will take it for repair, but "expect extended delay for return."  Screw it, at this point we'll get our money back and wait again for another chance.  I sincerely hope you have better luck than we did, but at least the first one still works!  BTW,  I found online this pairing issue seems pretty common, although NO fix offered resolved the problem with ours. Good luck!

I finally got one of these, but within an hour of use I realized I would have to return it as I could not tolerate the loud high pitch wavering ufo like noise coming from the fan. It wasn’t coil whine as it was a different type of noise, and it also did not make the noise in sleep mode. I have owned a fat ps2 and a launch ps4 as well as various other consoles and pcs over the years so it’s not like I went in expecting silence. Like the fan noise of the ps4 might be louder in decibels than the ps5, but the high pitch frequency of the ps5 makes it totally unlivable to me. It was actually painful being in the same room with it even when it was doing nothing but sitting on the Home Screen.When I looked into it I found out that Sony uses 3 different types of fans in the ps5, and the brand that I got is known for making the high pitch ufo noise. The ps5 is still scarce even though it’s been out for 2 years already, and possibly 1/3rd of them are manufactured with the “bad” fan type. So I chose to get an Xbox instead of going through the hassle of returning systems until I could find one with one of the other two brands of fan that doesn’t make the ufo noise.Pretty disappointed in the lack of quality/care coming from Sony. It’s a perfectly nice console if you either get lucky and get one of the quiet ones, or are not sensitive to high pitch noises.

review_title: Very happy with the graphics and the controller
review_comment: I didn't want to pay some eBay scalper a premium for a PS5, so few months ago I signed up for an "invitation" to buy one from Amazon at retail. I figured I had a slim chance of actually getting a PS5, but I could wait. Fast forward a few months and I was happy to see an invitation from Amazon!I am very glad that I got it. The graphics are the best I've seen and the controller is great! It even has a touch pad and tilt control.The only games I care about are racing simulators. I bought Gran Turismo 7, WRC 10, and Need For Speed Remastered. The PS5 does great with those games except for the latter (which is a PS4 game). It works with the PS5 controller, but not with a steering wheel and pedals. (This is the game developer's issue, not Sony's). But hopefully in a few months they will issue a new version of Need for Speed for the PS5.Anyway, get one of these if you can!

review_title: Great Console.  Infuriating customer support.  De facto ransomware.
review_comment: All the great things about this console are well-established.  I will tell you a few things that might give you pause. 1) Something random went wrong with my console, and it now boots to a safe mode menu with every option greyed out except "Reset PS5 (Reinstall System Software)."  I tried contacting PS Support through chat.  Once I was finally connected with an agent, the agent immediately closed the chat, before interacting with me in any way.  I tried to go to chat again, and received a message that said "Hey there, back so soon?, it seems Chat has not been of help to you, please try again tomorrow."2) As of launch, there was no way to backup saves to usb, they had to be put in the cloud, using PS Plus.  For people who don't care for multiplayer, and prefer to choose their own games rather than playing whatever PS Plus decides to "give away for free," PS Plus is a poor value.  It amounts to an insurance system for protecting your own (save) data, that over the course of a console cycle, costs as much as actually paying to retrieve your PC data from a ransomware user.  XBOX and PC, I am given to understand, allow cloud saves without payment.I'm not one to cut off my nose to spite my face, and Sony has some great exclusives.  But I'll think twice about buying third party games from their storefront in the future.

review_title: Can't handle the heat or direct sunlight
review_comment: First let me say, I love Mac and this is all I'll buy "for now".Don't use it outside in the sun or heat. Mine freezes constantly until the heat dissipates and makes it almost unusable. I am sitting outside in Belize where it is 29c/85f every day, all day long. This thing lasts 10 minutes before it can't handle it and then freezes for 30-60 seconds and becomes usable for a minute or two before starting again. Not to mention the permanent damage this could do over time.I avoid the sunlight for two reasons, the heat as I mentioned but the Touchbar is unreadable.Just my personal opinion on the Touchbar, it is the worst thing ever...I guess cause I just use the Function keys anyway but not being able to feal the keys when touch typing is horrible.Giving it 3 stars because I love mac but if you are on the fence and want to spend time outside in the summer...don't buy

I am not sure if Amazon will allow me to write a review for this new Apple MacBook Pro 2 ... as I chose to NOT buy it after checking it out.  I am hoping that somebody at Apple might see these comments from a current Mac owner.I'd like to explain why I DID NOT buy this new Macbook Pro...and went with a similarly sized AMOLED Samsung model instead.  I already own a Corei7 MacMini and own Logic Pro as well as FinalCut.  It would be GREAT if I could have this Apple software on a Macbook Pro too.  Main problem for me ... THE PORTS.  I simply do not want to drag around some bulky USB interface gadget that I have to plug in and plug out of my neat little laptop.  When I started looking elsewhere....I saw that a similar new model Samsung laptop not only has the same new USB ports as the new MacBook Pro ... but the Samsung also has a full size HDMI out, a microSD card reader, and one regular old fashioned USB port.  Oh...and I have a game changing and GORGEOUS AMOLED screen to boot.  Yea...I cannot run FinalCut or LogicPro on the road ... but I can still use that Apple software at home on the Mac Mini.  Apple... I just do not understand why you cannot engineer NEEDED ports back into Macbooks like Samsung and other have been able to do on their similarly sized models.  The Samsung model I bought via Amazon is the Samsung 13.3" Galaxy Book2 Pro with 12th gen i7, 8gb, 512gb ... with my own real money.  I have NOTHING to do with Samsung or Amazon and got nothing from any source for writing this appeal to Apple.  Tks.

review_title: Ready to lose all compatibility with older macs/ext SSD/SDmemory! How about no print drivers!
review_comment: The M1 and M2 series of Macs are more of an attempt to remove compatibility to any external hard drives of other macs (pre Big Sur) and require a new drive format which has no new advantages.  They are also not yet supported by most popular printer companies ... no Epson printer drivers for 2 years now! My only guess is that apple wants all customers to use icloud drives online with no other easy options!  Maybe they will make printing an apple service too?  This is a deal breaker for me ... I need to be able to xfer file from one machine to another be it mac or windows machines.  Another massive disappointment in apple to create great hardware but make it dysfunctional!

review_title: It seems a bit niche at this point
review_comment: Full disclosure: This is not my daily device. IT purchased one of these at work because they couldn't wait on the M2 MacBook Air, but now they wish they had.I have been using this device for a few weeks now and there is absolutely nothing wrong with it. I have been a huge fan of Apple Silicon architecture since its release, and I originally purchased the 13" MBP with the M1 chip in it before upgrading to the 16" M1 Max that I use now. Apple Silicon is a game changer and really sets the standard for creative workloads.My issue at this point is what exactly this M2 version of the 13" MBP brings to the table. The 2022 MacBook Pro with the M2 chip utilizes the older chassis from the previous gen. As such, your port options are limited and you do not get MagSafe charging. The chassis also is starting to look a bit dated with Apple shifting towards cleaner and flatter lines on their devices.The 2022 MacBook Air has everything you need in a device around this price point. With the 2022 MacBook Air, you will get MagSafe charging, you will get a larger 13.6" screen with smaller bevels (vs. 13.3" on MBP), you will get 1080p camera (720p on MBP), you will get lighter weight at 2.7lbs (3lbs on MBP), and you will get Apple's newer chassis.The MBP does include a fan for active cooling, as well as the touchbar. If you're purchasing the Apple MacBook Pro 13" for tasks that require active cooling as a necessity, you will likely need a minimum of 16gb of RAM, at which point your best bet is to spend the extra $200 and upgrade to the 14" MacBook Pro with the M1 Pro chip. I have never met anyone who just really likes the touch bar to the point that it's a game changer, but if you really need that touch bar, this is the only way you can get it now.The M2 MacBook Pro also provides 2hrs of better battery life than the MacBook Air, but this is not worth sacrificing all of the other benefits of the Air.Overall, if you purchase this device, it will perform well and do everything you really need. It is a good computer and you will be happy with it. At the same time, there are BETTER purchase options on either end of the spectrum, creating sort of a niche market of consumers for which the 13" MBP is desired. My recommendation is to either purchase the 2022 MacBook Air, or go ahead and step up to the 14" MacBook Pro M1.
